Flexibility, freedom to share work. Collaborative colleagues

job_title: Finance and Operations Manager in Kano, Kano
cons: Too much control from head quarters office, they micro manage too much

review_title: Passionate people and exciting missions, but progress is often slower than expected.
pros: People in the San Francisco office are passionate about their job and the mission of the company. In other offices, people are passionate but are with the company more for the job opportunities. Almost everyone is friendly and excited about the work they are doing. Almost everyone is both professional and personal with you-- great people to work with.
cons: Hard for critical people to come together and discuss important opportunities sometimes. Almost everyone is busy, and in the san francisco office, often overstretched. Will be hard to implement new ideas.

pros: Friendly work environment, flexible time, listening grievances of the employee and motivation thereof is good management perspective, I got in the current employment.
cons: We specifically relied on business development to have new project all the time which management, I think, has not taken steps on appropriate time.

pros: Good programs and aid from the federal government
cons: Present Management has become very short sighted. It is not a fit place to work for career development or professional growth.

pros: Committed team both in US and internationally
cons: Systems of a smaller nonprofit (i.e. not as robust as a larger org)
